channel.title: Papers with Code: Latest (unofficial)
channel.description: As a disclaimer, this is an unofficial feed and has no affiliation with Papers with Code.

item.title: Dynamic Graph Message Passing Networks for Visual Recognition
item.description: A fully-connected graph, such as the self-attention operation in Transformers, is beneficial for such modelling, however, its computational overhead is prohibitive.

item.title: Unsupervised Early Exit in DNNs with Multiple Exits
item.description: Hence one is faced with the problem of selecting the optimal exit in an unsupervised setting.

item.title: Review of data types and model dimensionality for cardiac DTI SMS-related artefact removal
item.description: As diffusion tensor imaging (DTI) gains popularity in cardiac imaging due to its unique ability to non-invasively assess the cardiac microstructure, deep learning-based Artificial Intelligence is becoming a crucial tool in mitigating some of its drawbacks, such as the long scan times.

item.title: Cross-modal Learning for Image-Guided Point Cloud Shape Completion
item.description: In this paper we explore the recent topic of point cloud completion, guided by an auxiliary image.

item.title: View-Disentangled Transformer for Brain Lesion Detection
item.description: Deep neural networks (DNNs) have been widely adopted in brain lesion detection and segmentation.

item.title: Revisiting Image Pyramid Structure for High Resolution Salient Object Detection
item.description: Salient object detection (SOD) has been in the spotlight recently, yet has been studied less for high-resolution (HR) images.

item.title: CoV-TI-Net: Transferred Initialization with Modified End Layer for COVID-19 Diagnosis
item.description: In this research, the PyTorch pre-trained models (VGG19\_bn and WideResNet -101) are applied in the MNIST dataset for the first time as initialization and with modified fully connected layers.

item.title: A Joint Imitation-Reinforcement Learning Framework for Reduced Baseline Regret
item.description: The learning process in JIRL assumes the availability of a baseline policy and is designed with two objectives in mind \textbf{(a)} leveraging the baseline's online demonstrations to minimize the regret w. r. t the baseline policy during training, and \textbf{(b)} eventually surpassing the baseline performance.

item.title: Improving Replay-Based Continual Semantic Segmentation with Smart Data Selection
item.description: Continual learning for Semantic Segmentation (CSS) is a rapidly emerging field, in which the capabilities of the segmentation model are incrementally improved by learning new classes or new domains.

item.title: Interpretable Edge Enhancement and Suppression Learning for 3D Point Cloud Segmentation
item.description: Second, we experimentally observe and verify the edge enhancement and suppression behavior.

item.title: A Data-Centric AI Paradigm Based on Application-Driven Fine-grained Dataset Design
item.description: Deep learning has a wide range of applications in industrial scenario, but reducing false alarm (FA) remains a major difficulty.

item.title: Feature embedding in click-through rate prediction
item.description: The embedding modules act as a way to improve baseline model feature embeddings and are trained alongside the rest of the model parameters in an end-to-end manner.

item.title: A Framework for Benchmarking Clustering Algorithms
item.description: The evaluation of clustering algorithms can be performed by running them on a variety of benchmark problems, and comparing their outputs to the reference, ground-truth groupings provided by experts.

item.title: Can we do that simpler? Simple, Efficient, High-Quality Evaluation Metrics for NLG
item.description: We explore efficient evaluation metrics for Natural Language Generation (NLG).

item.title: An Outlier Exposure Approach to Improve Visual Anomaly Detection Performance for Mobile Robots
item.description: We consider the problem of building visual anomaly detection systems for mobile robots.

item.title: Detecting respiratory motion artefacts for cardiovascular MRIs to ensure high-quality segmentation
item.description: In cardiovascular magnetic resonance imaging (CMR), respiratory motion represents a major challenge in terms of acquisition quality and therefore subsequent analysis and final diagnosis.

item.title: Sparse Vicious Attacks on Graph Neural Networks
item.description: In this work, we focus on a specific, white-box attack to GNN-based link prediction models, where a malicious node aims to appear in the list of recommended nodes for a given target victim.

item.title: Closing the Gender Wage Gap: Adversarial Fairness in Job Recommendation
item.description: We conclude that adversarial debiasing of word representations can increase real-world fairness of systems and thus may be part of the solution for creating fairness-aware recommendation systems.

item.title: ViTag: Online WiFi Fine Time Measurements Aided Vision-Motion Identity Association in Multi-person Environments
item.description: ViTag associates a sequence of vision tracker generated bounding boxes with Inertial Measurement Unit (IMU) data and Wi-Fi Fine Time Measurements (FTM) from smartphones.

item.title: Text2Light: Zero-Shot Text-Driven HDR Panorama Generation
item.description: To achieve super-resolution inverse tone mapping, we derive a continuous representation of 360-degree imaging from the LDR panorama as a set of structured latent codes anchored to the sphere.

item.title: Automatic Label Sequence Generation for Prompting Sequence-to-sequence Models
item.description: Prompting, which casts downstream applications as language modeling tasks, has shown to be sample efficient compared to standard fine-tuning with pre-trained models.

item.title: Target-Guided Open-Domain Conversation Planning
item.description: Prior studies addressing target-oriented conversational tasks lack a crucial notion that has been intensively studied in the context of goal-oriented artificial intelligence agents, namely, planning.

item.title: Extremely Simple Activation Shaping for Out-of-Distribution Detection
item.description: The separation between training and deployment of machine learning models implies that not all scenarios encountered in deployment can be anticipated during training, and therefore relying solely on advancements in training has its limits.

item.title: Non-Linguistic Supervision for Contrastive Learning of Sentence Embeddings
item.description: This indicates that Transformer models are able to generalize better by doing a similar task (i. e., clustering) with unpaired examples from different modalities in a multi-task fashion.

item.title: LED down the rabbit hole: exploring the potential of global attention for biomedical multi-document summarisation
item.description: In this paper we report on our submission to the Multidocument Summarisation for Literature Review (MSLR) shared task.

item.title: Global Optimization for Cardinality-constrained Minimum Sum-of-Squares Clustering via Semidefinite Programming
item.description: For the upper bound, instead, we present a local search procedure that exploits the solution of the SDP relaxation solved at each node.

item.title: Batch Layer Normalization, A new normalization layer for CNNs and RNN
item.description: As a combined version of batch and layer normalization, BLN adaptively puts appropriate weight on mini-batch and feature normalization based on the inverse size of mini-batches to normalize the input to a layer during the learning process.

item.title: Rethinking Knowledge Graph Evaluation Under the Open-World Assumption
item.description: However, evaluation of knowledge graph completion (KGC) models often ignores the incompleteness -- facts in the test set are ranked against all unknown triplets which may contain a large number of missing facts not included in the KG yet.

item.title: Training an Assassin AI for The Resistance: Avalon
item.description: Implementing an AI for this game involves multiple components specific to each phase as well as role in the game.

item.title: Rewarding Episodic Visitation Discrepancy for Exploration in Reinforcement Learning
item.description: Exploration is critical for deep reinforcement learning in complex environments with high-dimensional observations and sparse rewards.

item.title: Dual-Geometric Space Embedding Model for Two-View Knowledge Graphs
item.description: For works that seek to put both views of the KG together, the instance and ontology views are assumed to belong to the same geometric space, such as all nodes embedded in the same Euclidean space or non-Euclidean product space, an assumption no longer reasonable for two-view KGs where different portions of the graph exhibit different structures.

item.title: Traffic incident duration prediction via a deep learning framework for text description encoding
item.description: Predicting the traffic incident duration is a hard problem to solve due to the stochastic nature of incident occurrence in space and time, a lack of information at the beginning of a reported traffic disruption, and lack of advanced methods in transport engineering to derive insights from past accidents.

item.title: Probing Spurious Correlations in Popular Event-Based Rumor Detection Benchmarks
item.description: As social media becomes a hotbed for the spread of misinformation, the crucial task of rumor detection has witnessed promising advances fostered by open-source benchmark datasets.

item.title: LGC-Net: A Lightweight Gyroscope Calibration Network for Efficient Attitude Estimation
item.description: This paper presents a lightweight, efficient calibration neural network model for denoising low-cost microelectromechanical system (MEMS) gyroscope and estimating the attitude of a robot in real-time.

item.title: Measuring Interventional Robustness in Reinforcement Learning
item.description: Recent work in reinforcement learning has focused on several characteristics of learned policies that go beyond maximizing reward.

item.title: Robust leave-one-out cross-validation for high-dimensional Bayesian models
item.description: Our method retains the simplicity and computational convenience of classical approaches, while guaranteeing finite variance of the resulting estimators.

item.title: The Biased Artist: Exploiting Cultural Biases via Homoglyphs in Text-Guided Image Generation Models
item.description: Our results further indicate that text encoders trained on multilingual data provide a way to mitigate the effects of homoglyph replacements.

item.title: D&D: Learning Human Dynamics from Dynamic Camera
item.description: In this work, we present D&D (Learning Human Dynamics from Dynamic Camera), which leverages the laws of physics to reconstruct 3D human motion from the in-the-wild videos with a moving camera.

item.title: Attentive Symmetric Autoencoder for Brain MRI Segmentation
item.description: Self-supervised learning methods based on image patch reconstruction have witnessed great success in training auto-encoders, whose pre-trained weights can be transferred to fine-tune other downstream tasks of image understanding.

item.title: Multi-Task Vision Transformer for Semi-Supervised Driver Distraction Detection
item.description: Driver distraction detection is an important computer vision problem that can play a crucial role in enhancing traffic safety and reducing traffic accidents.

item.title: 3D-PL: Domain Adaptive Depth Estimation with 3D-aware Pseudo-Labeling
item.description: In this paper, we develop a domain adaptation framework via generating reliable pseudo ground truths of depth from real data to provide direct supervisions.

item.title: Joint Language Semantic and Structure Embedding for Knowledge Graph Completion
item.description: Unlike previous approaches that rely on either the structures or semantics of the knowledge graphs, we propose to jointly embed the semantics in the natural language description of the knowledge triplets with their structure information.

item.title: Deep Metric Learning with Chance Constraints
item.description: To provide a scalable algorithm as well as exploiting more proxies, we consider the chance constraints implied by the minimizers of proxy-based DML instances and reformulate DML as finding a feasible point in intersection of such constraints, resulting in a problem to be approximately solved by iterative projections.

item.title: Visible-Infrared Person Re-Identification Using Privileged Intermediate Information
item.description: % This paper introduces a novel approach for a creating intermediate virtual domain that acts as bridges between the two main domains (i. e., RGB and IR modalities) during training.

item.title: Understanding reinforcement learned crowds
item.description: Each of these choices has a significant, and potentially nontrivial impact on the results, and so researchers should be mindful about choosing and reporting them in their work.

item.title: HiMFR: A Hybrid Masked Face Recognition Through Face Inpainting
item.description: Inspired by the recent image inpainting methods, we propose an end-to-end hybrid masked face recognition system, namely HiMFR, consisting of three significant parts: masked face detector, face inpainting, and face recognition.

item.title: On Robust Cross-View Consistency in Self-Supervised Monocular Depth Estimation
item.description: Compared with the photometric consistency loss as well as the rigid point cloud alignment loss, the proposed DFA and VDA losses are more robust owing to the strong representation power of deep features as well as the high tolerance of voxel density to the aforementioned challenges.

item.title: Decentralized Vehicle Coordination: The Berkeley DeepDrive Drone Dataset
item.description: Decentralized multiagent planning has been an important field of research in robotics.

item.title: GLARE: A Dataset for Traffic Sign Detection in Sun Glare
item.description: Real-time machine learning detection algorithms are often found within autonomous vehicle technology and depend on quality datasets.

item.title: Structure-Aware 3D VR Sketch to 3D Shape Retrieval
item.description: In particular, we propose to use a triplet loss with an adaptive margin value driven by a "fitting gap", which is the similarity of two shapes under structure-preserving deformations.
